critique: This document concerns the opening of public lands in Wyoming to homesteading and desert land laws, initially prioritizing ex-service men. It revokes a previous executive order that withdrew the land pending a resurvey. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, executive power grab, or emphasis on national security. It touches on federalism by opening federal lands, and economic regulation by enabling homesteading. Social inclusion is slightly impacted by prioritizing ex-service men.
